bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Ah, not that granite dead and cold!
bibl.orgName: The Pierpont Morgan Library, New York
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

lg.head: Ah, not thisthat granite dead and cold
lg.l: Ah, not thisthat granite dead and cold!

Far far from its base and shaft expanding—the
round zones circling, comprehending

No limited lurid fame exceptional for thee nNormonstrousribroportiousin
tellest nor conquest domination

Thou Washington are all the world's the continent's—not
yours alone, America

Europe's as well, in every part,in castle or incastle of lord or laborer's cot—
or from north, or sultry south— The Arab's in his tent— the African's,

Old Asias there with venerable smile seated
amid her rains,

(Greets the antique the hero new ? 'tis but the
same—theundyingindubitableheart and harm—the
heir legitimate—the same unbroken—proofs of the never broken line

Courage, alertness, patience, hope, the same—e'en
in defeat defeated not the same;)

Whereveryeversails by ship, sails, or house is built on land,
or night or day,

Through teeming citie's streets, indoors or out,
factories or farms,

Now or to come or past—wherever patriot
wills existed or exist

Wherever Freedom, poised by Toleration, swayed
by Law—in them, from them,
Rising or risen, there's thy true monument,
Rises or stands or is rising thy true monument
